nodes.body:
### PR summary [b0ce30989a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19753/commits/b0ce30989a48fd07c7e13c64152865e11a65c6b4)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ emultiplicity_eq_ofNat`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Do we need `no_index` here if we are not adding this as a `simp` theorem?
Aha, interesting, seems like not, removed. Thanks!
It could still be used with `simp [enultiplicity_eq_ofNat]`, so maybe it should be kept

Now that I looked, I found a decent number of similar non-simp lemmas with it now (e.g. `floor_add_ofNat`, `ceil_add_ofNat`, `PosSemidef.ofNat`, ...) so I've put it back, presumably for the reason you mention, though I'm obviously happy to follow whatever you tell me to do if preferred.
Note that you don't use `ofNat` in the RHS. What do you get (full term, not pretty-printed), if you (a) `rw`; (b) `simp` using this lemma?

Thanks Yury.

<details>

<summary>I get (before and after the rewrite)</summary>

```
⊢ And (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 9 (instOfNatNat 9)) (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 18 (instOfNatNat 18)))
  (Not
    (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 27 (instOfNatNat 27))
      (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 18 (instOfNatNat 18))))

▶ expected type (10:9-10:31)
⊢ ∀ {a b n : Nat} [inst : Nat.AtLeastTwo n],
  Iff
    (@Eq.{1} ENat (@emultiplicity.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid a b)
      (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} ENat n (@instOfNatAtLeastTwo.{0} ENat n ENat.instNatCast inst)))
    (And
      (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd
        (@HPow.hPow.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHPow.{0, 0} Nat Nat (@Monoid.toNatPow.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid)) a n) b)
      (Not
        (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd
          (@HPow.hPow.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHPow.{0, 0} Nat Nat (@Monoid.toNatPow.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid)) a
            (@HAdd.hAdd.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHAdd.{0} Nat instAddNat) n
              (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 1 (instOfNatNat 1))))
          b)))

-- /Users/julian/Development/mathlib4/foo.lean at 5:3
⊢ @Eq.{1} ENat
  (@emultiplicity.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 3 (instOfNatNat 3))
    (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 18 (instOfNatNat 18)))
  (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} ENat 2
    (@instOfNatAtLeastTwo.{0} ENat 2 ENat.instNatCast (@instNatAtLeastTwo (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 0 (instOfNatNat 0)))))

-- /Users/julian/Development/mathlib4/foo.lean at 5:29
⊢ And
  (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd
    (@HPow.hPow.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHPow.{0, 0} Nat Nat (@Monoid.toNatPow.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid))
      (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 3 (instOfNatNat 3)) 2)
    (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 18 (instOfNatNat 18)))
  (Not
    (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd
      (@HPow.hPow.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHPow.{0, 0} Nat Nat (@Monoid.toNatPow.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid))
        (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 3 (instOfNatNat 3))
        (@HAdd.hAdd.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHAdd.{0} Nat instAddNat) 2 (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 1 (instOfNatNat 1))))
      (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 18 (instOfNatNat 18))))

▶ expected type (5:7-5:29)
⊢ ∀ {a b n : Nat} [inst : Nat.AtLeastTwo n],
  Iff
    (@Eq.{1} ENat (@emultiplicity.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid a b)
      (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} ENat n (@instOfNatAtLeastTwo.{0} ENat n ENat.instNatCast inst)))
    (And
      (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd
        (@HPow.hPow.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHPow.{0, 0} Nat Nat (@Monoid.toNatPow.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid)) a n) b)
      (Not
        (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd
          (@HPow.hPow.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHPow.{0, 0} Nat Nat (@Monoid.toNatPow.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid)) a
            (@HAdd.hAdd.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHAdd.{0} Nat instAddNat) n
              (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 1 (instOfNatNat 1))))
          b)))

-- /Users/julian/Development/mathlib4/foo.lean at 10:3
⊢ @Eq.{1} ENat
  (@emultiplicity.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 3 (instOfNatNat 3))
    (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 18 (instOfNatNat 18)))
  (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} ENat 2
    (@instOfNatAtLeastTwo.{0} ENat 2 ENat.instNatCast (@instNatAtLeastTwo (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 0 (instOfNatNat 0)))))

-- /Users/julian/Development/mathlib4/foo.lean at 10:31
⊢ And (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 9 (instOfNatNat 9)) (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 18 (instOfNatNat 18)))
  (Not
    (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 27 (instOfNatNat 27))
      (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 18 (instOfNatNat 18))))

▶ expected type (10:9-10:31)
⊢ ∀ {a b n : Nat} [inst : Nat.AtLeastTwo n],
  Iff
    (@Eq.{1} ENat (@emultiplicity.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid a b)
      (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} ENat n (@instOfNatAtLeastTwo.{0} ENat n ENat.instNatCast inst)))
    (And
      (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd
        (@HPow.hPow.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHPow.{0, 0} Nat Nat (@Monoid.toNatPow.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid)) a n) b)
      (Not
        (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd
          (@HPow.hPow.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHPow.{0, 0} Nat Nat (@Monoid.toNatPow.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid)) a
            (@HAdd.hAdd.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHAdd.{0} Nat instAddNat) n
              (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 1 (instOfNatNat 1))))
          b)))
```

</details>

If I change the RHS to be:

```lean
    emultiplicity a b = (no_index (OfNat.ofNat n) : ℕ∞) ↔
      a ^ (no_index (OfNat.ofNat n) : ℕ) ∣ b ∧ ¬a ^ ((no_index (OfNat.ofNat n) : ℕ) + 1) ∣ b :=
```

<details>

<summary>I instead get</summary>

```

-- /Users/julian/Development/mathlib4/foo.lean at 5:3
⊢ @Eq.{1} ENat
  (@emultiplicity.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 3 (instOfNatNat 3))
    (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 18 (instOfNatNat 18)))
  (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} ENat 2
    (@instOfNatAtLeastTwo.{0} ENat 2 ENat.instNatCast (@instNatAtLeastTwo (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 0 (instOfNatNat 0)))))

-- /Users/julian/Development/mathlib4/foo.lean at 5:29
⊢ And
  (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd
    (@HPow.hPow.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHPow.{0, 0} Nat Nat (@Monoid.toNatPow.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid))
      (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 3 (instOfNatNat 3)) (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 2 (instOfNatNat 2)))
    (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 18 (instOfNatNat 18)))
  (Not
    (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd
      (@HPow.hPow.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHPow.{0, 0} Nat Nat (@Monoid.toNatPow.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid))
        (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 3 (instOfNatNat 3))
        (@HAdd.hAdd.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHAdd.{0} Nat instAddNat) (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 2 (instOfNatNat 2))
          (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 1 (instOfNatNat 1))))
      (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 18 (instOfNatNat 18))))

▶ expected type (5:7-5:29)
⊢ ∀ {a b n : Nat} [inst : Nat.AtLeastTwo n],
  Iff
    (@Eq.{1} ENat (@emultiplicity.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid a b)
      (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} ENat n (@instOfNatAtLeastTwo.{0} ENat n ENat.instNatCast inst)))
    (And
      (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd
        (@HPow.hPow.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHPow.{0, 0} Nat Nat (@Monoid.toNatPow.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid)) a
          (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat n (instOfNatNat n)))
        b)
      (Not
        (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd
          (@HPow.hPow.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHPow.{0, 0} Nat Nat (@Monoid.toNatPow.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid)) a
            (@HAdd.hAdd.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHAdd.{0} Nat instAddNat) (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat n (instOfNatNat n))
              (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 1 (instOfNatNat 1))))
          b)))

-- /Users/julian/Development/mathlib4/foo.lean at 10:3
⊢ @Eq.{1} ENat
  (@emultiplicity.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 3 (instOfNatNat 3))
    (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 18 (instOfNatNat 18)))
  (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} ENat 2
    (@instOfNatAtLeastTwo.{0} ENat 2 ENat.instNatCast (@instNatAtLeastTwo (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 0 (instOfNatNat 0)))))

-- /Users/julian/Development/mathlib4/foo.lean at 10:31
⊢ And (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 9 (instOfNatNat 9)) (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 18 (instOfNatNat 18)))
  (Not
    (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 27 (instOfNatNat 27))
      (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 18 (instOfNatNat 18))))

▶ expected type (10:9-10:31)
⊢ ∀ {a b n : Nat} [inst : Nat.AtLeastTwo n],
  Iff
    (@Eq.{1} ENat (@emultiplicity.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid a b)
      (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} ENat n (@instOfNatAtLeastTwo.{0} ENat n ENat.instNatCast inst)))
    (And
      (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd
        (@HPow.hPow.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHPow.{0, 0} Nat Nat (@Monoid.toNatPow.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid)) a
          (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat n (instOfNatNat n)))
        b)
      (Not
        (@Dvd.dvd.{0} Nat Nat.instDvd
          (@HPow.hPow.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHPow.{0, 0} Nat Nat (@Monoid.toNatPow.{0} Nat Nat.instMonoid)) a
            (@HAdd.hAdd.{0, 0, 0} Nat Nat Nat (@instHAdd.{0} Nat instAddNat) (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat n (instOfNatNat n))
              (@OfNat.ofNat.{0} Nat 1 (instOfNatNat 1))))
          b)))


```

</details>

I'm not 100% sure what I'm looking for (and I see a few examples of lemmas that also do not have `OfNat` on the RHS, e.g. [this one](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/b0ce30989a48fd07c7e13c64152865e11a65c6b4/Mathlib/Algebra/Polynomial/Eval/Defs.lean#L401). I see a small diff between the two terms obviously. Can you help me understand what I should be seeing there in terms of red flags (or lack thereof)?

pullRequest.title: feat: missing emultiplicity coercion lemma
